content: evergranny ← canva doc & youtube tutorial↓ easy crochet tote bag pattern - evergranny tote bags mini / midi / maxi ⭐ evergranny tote bag introduction a modern take on the classic granny square turned into a practical tote bag in 3 different sizes - mini midi & maxi this pattern is very versatile and easily adjustable to the preferred dimensions feel free to experiment kami crochet materials yarn yarnart jeans or any other weight 2 cotton / acrylic blend hook 3 mm notions scissors yarn needle sizes yarnart jeans dimensions mini 45 g / 145 m / 160 yds 18 x 20 cm / 7 x 8 in midi 85 g / 275 m / 300 yds 27 x 28 cm / 10 5 x 11 in maxi 155 g / 500 m / 550 yds 34 x 38 cm / 13 5 x 15 in abbreviations st / sts - stitch / stitches magic_ring - magic_ring single_crochet - single_crochet half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet double_crochet - double_crochet stsc - stacked single_crochet fo - fasten_off notes stsc stacked single_crochet counts as a double_crochet cluster granny stitch = 3 double_crochet in the same space fo fasten_off chain 1 pull the yarn through the loop and tighten joining half_double_crochet at the end of each granny square round & chains do not count as stitches everyone makes a granny square slightly differently whatever you do make sure you finish yours in the corner otherwise cut the yarn and attach it in the corner for the handles if your granny square is curling up don t worry about it it will straighten up once the bag is finished when changing colors i recommend carrying up to 3 different strands of yarn between row to avoid bulk tl dr for veterans granny square 10 rounds = mini 15 rounds = midi 20 rounds = maxi turn double_crochet 6 / 9 / 12 chain 45 / 60 / 75 double_crochet into the last 6 / 9 / 12 sts 12 / 18 / 24 sts turn double_crochet across 57 / 78 / 99 sts mini fasten_off cut the yarn midi turn single_crochet across 78 sts maxi turn double_crochet across 99 sts midi & maxi fasten_off cut the yarn make another identical panel & keep yarn attached align both panels with the right sides facing outwards and single_crochet around the edges 1 single_crochet in top corners of the granny square 2 single_crochet in bottom corners going through 4 loops at a time to join 104 / 151 / 198 sts fasten_off weave in the ends done evergranny round 1 magic_ring stsc double_crochet 2 chain 2 double_crochet 3 x3 half_double_crochet into the stsc 12 sts / 4 clusters round 2 stsc double_crochet 2 into the half_double_crochet space cluster chain 2 cluster into the next chain 2 space corner repeat 3 times back in the first half_double_crochet space cluster half_double_crochet into the stsc 24 sts / 8 clusters rounds 3+ place 1 cluster in every side space & cluster chain
